content:
D. honouring their father and mother. 
19. One of the reforms of King Josiah was that 
A. he worshipped at the brook Kidron 
B. he defiled Topheth in the valley of the sons of Hinnom. 
C. he allowed the worship of Asherah 
D. the priests were allowed to worship in the temple. 
 
20. The main lesson of Hosea’s teachings is that God 
A. will pour His spirit on all flesh. 
B. accepts every free-will offering 
C. will create a new heart in His people 
D. prefers steadfast love to sacrifice. 
 
21. The reaction of Naaman to the instruction of Elisha 
showed that he was 
A. proud B. faithless C. ignorant D. stubborn. 
 
22. Daniel became distinguished above all other presidents 
and satraps because he 
A. interpreted the king’s dreams 
B. refused to worship the golden calf. 
C. worshipped only one God 
D. had an excellent spirit in him. 
 
23. When Elijah escaped from Ahab to the brook Cherith, 
he was fed by 
A. angels B. ravens C. doves D. sparrows. 
 
24. The man appointed by the Holy Ghost to go on the 
missionary journey with Saul was 
A. Lucius B. Barnabas C. Peter D. Mark 
 
25. The mark of a true disciple according to Jesus Christ is 
A. loving one another 
B. keeping the ten commandments 
C. knowing the word 
D. fasting and praying. 
 
26. The main complaint of the Hellenists against the 
brews in the early Church was that their 
A. men were neglected 
B. widows were neglected 
C. new converts were neglected 
D. children were neglected. 
 
27. Peter, James and John were asked to keep their 
experience of the transfiguration secret until 
A. the kingdom of God comes 
B. they met the other disciples 
C. they descended from the mount 
D. the son of man is raised from the dead. 
 
28. According to Jesus, every branch of tree that bears 
fruit, He would prune. Branch in this context refers to 
A. man B. an angel C. the Jews D. the Gentiles. 
 
29. John declares that for a man to have eternal life he must 
A. preach the gospel of Christ 
B. possess the Holy Spirit 
C. beat everyone that sold and bought 
D. drove out all who sold and bought. 
30. When Jesus entered the temple in Jerusalem, He 
A. contended with the scribes and the Pharisees. 
B. read from the book of Isaiah 
C. beat everyone that sold and bought 
D. drove out all who sold and bought. 
 
31. Jesus’ reply to the Devil’s command to throw Himself 
down from the pinnacle of the temple was 
A“… Man shall not live by bread alone…” 
B. “… You shall not tempt the Lord your God.” 
C. ’’… You shall worship the Lord your God and Him 
only shall you serve.” 
D. “He will give his angels charge of you.” 
 
32. “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?” The 
lawyer who asked this question wanted to 
A. put Christ to the test.   B. please the crowd 
C. prove his knowledge of the law D. condemn Christ. 
 
33. In the story of stilling the storm, the disciples were 
surprised because 
A. Jesus was deeply asleep in the boat while the 
storm raged 
B. Jesus rebuked them for lack of faith 
C. the wind and the sea obeyed  Jesus 
D. the storm disturbed the boat even with Jesus in 
it. 
 
34.  In his reference to the events of the day of Pentecost, 
Peter said that they were the fulfillment of the prophecy 
of 
A. Jeremiah B. Joel C. Jonah D. Isaiah. 
35. “Yes, Lord; I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of 
God, He who is coming into the world.” The confession 
was made during the 
A. changing of water to wine 
B. transfiguration of Jesus Christ 
C. raising of Lazarus 
D. healing of the epileptic boy. 
36. Before Jesus raised Jairus’ daughter, the people mocked 
Him because he 
A. told them that the girl was not dead but sleeping 
B. rebuked them for weeping and mourning over the 
dead 
C. did not pray before performing the miracle 
D. did not arrive at the place before the girl died. 
37. When Bartimaeus wanted Jesus to heal him, he 
A. waited for Him by the roadside 
B. requested to be led to Him. 
C. expressed his faith in Him. 
D. persistently cried out for help. 
38. The teachers of the law accused Jesus of blasphemy 
because He 
A. claimed to have power to heal the sick 
B. declared that He had authority to forgive sin 
C. said sin was the cause of sickness 
D. called Himself Son of Man. 
 
39. “Have nothing to do with that righteous man, for I have
